issue.title: [P4Testgen] How to capture traces in generated test cases?

labels.name: testgen
labels.description: Topics related to the P4Testgen back end

issue.body:
I see there is `traces` field in the `TestCase` proto:

https://github.com/p4lang/p4c/blob/112b734b5b23500c53c199b30bb2d914c52c146c/backends/p4tools/modules/testgen/targets/bmv2/proto/p4testgen.proto#L24-L36

But when I use `p4testgen` with the `--print-traces` option (for a v1model/bmv2 P4 program), I only see traces printed out in terminal, but not recorded in the generated test cases.

I wonder if this is the expected behavior? And how can I capture traces in generated test cases?

commits.message: Fix textproto generation and escape traces properly. (#4207)

pull_request.title: [P4Testgen] Fix textproto generation and escape traces properly.
pull_request.body:
Cheap workaround to deal with double quote characters within a trace object. Also fix up the Protobuf format for P4Testgen test messages. We are currently not testing these, so breakages were not detected.

Fixes #4202. @qobilidop

labels.name: testgen
labels.description: Topics related to the P4Testgen back end

commits.message:
Fix P4TC issues (#4209)

* Fix EBPF issues.
Generate Template file with executable permissons
Generate Template and Introspection file by default

* Remove '-i' and '-c' options

* Addressed comments

* Rename kfunc bpf_skb_p4tc_tbl_read to bpf_skb_p4tc_tbl_read
Move declaration of 'struct hdr_md' from post_parser.cpp to header.h file

* Change post_parser.c file name to control_block.c

* Delete old post_parser.c files

pull_request.title: Fix P4TC issues
pull_request.body:
Issues addressed -

1) In the parser generation remove an extraneous semicolon from file include code. 
2) In the parser generated code declare compiler_meta struct:
struct pna_global_metadata *compiler_meta__ = (struct pna_global_metadata *) skb->cb;
3) Make generated template file to have executable permissions
4) Generate template file by default (should have same name as pipeline)
5) Generate the introspection file by default with the SAME name as the pipeline.
6) Rename kfunc bpf_skb_p4tc_tbl_read to bpf_skb_p4tc_tbl_read
7) Move declaration of 'struct hdr_md' from post_parser.cpp to header.h file
8) Change post_parser.c file name to control_block.c
9) Remove '-i' and -'c' options.

commits.message: Always insert instantiation statement at the end of the local statement list (#3962)

Implement support for default initializers (...) (#3968)

* Implement support for default initializers (...)
Signed-off-by: Mihai Budiu <mbudiu@vmware.com>

Add style and formating files for Python. Format Python code. (#3870)

* Add style files.

* Format.

* Update version.

* Enforce yapf linting.

* Filter some folders.

* New Format.

* Style change.

* Switch to black instead of yapf.

* Remove inline comments.

* Use a lower black version for Ubuntu 18.04

* Add isort to linter checks.

* Run isort.

* Some tweaks.

* Readme.
Bump Bazel dependency versions to enable using latest Bazel (#3979)

Cleanup some P4Testgen code.  (#3978)

* Refactoring and cleanup.

* Fix header location in gtest.

* More small edits.

* Review comments.

Make StateVariable an IR class that accepts IR::Member. Use ICastable for some nodes. (#3741)

* Make StateVariable only accept IR::Member. Use ICastable for some nodes.

* Make StateVariable an IR class.

* Simplify formulae. Do not use imprecise Value, instead use precise IR::Literal.

* Fix formatting issues.

Fix.

* Fix problems after rebase.

* Review comments.

* Minor cleanup.

Set up P4C for IWYU (#3981)

* Apply IWYU to all targets.

* The Bazel build is flawed, so make sure CMake uses the same include style as Bazel does.

* Add some IWYU pragmas.

Also include the backend IR files in the ir-generated library file. (#3985)

* Build fixes.

* Clean up dependencies.

* More build order edits.

* Enum insertion order?
FreeBSD patches (#3991)

Add some more type information to the strength reduction pass. (#3993)

* Add some more type information to the strength reduction pass.

* Leave shifts untyped? Why?

Run linters across test folder. (#3982)

* Also lint test.

* Run the linter.

* Ignore revs for Python.

Split state variables and symbolic variables. Stricter type checking. (#3987)

* Split state variables and symbolic variables. Stricter type checking.

* Rename variables appropriately.

* IWYU.

* Refactor the concolic execution model. Push concolic refresh into final state.

* Fix up gtests.

* Remove flawed test.

* Move packet variables out of the execution state.

* State variables never used the incarnation count. Remove.

* There is no need to look up the declaration in convertPathExpr.

[P4Testgen] Clean up the implementation of the BMv2 clone externs.  (#3976)

* Clean up the implementation of the BMv2 clone implementation. Use explicit info objects to maintain state.

* A different clone id is not needed. Instead, we should fix PI.

* Update the session ID maximum.

* Merge fixes.

Release v1.2.3.9 (#3998)

Changelog:
- [P4Testgen] Clean up the implementation of the BMv2 clone externs (3976) [Fabian Ruffy]
- Split state variables and symbolic variables. Stricter type checking. (3987) [Fabian Ruffy]
- Run linters across test folder. (3982) [Fabian Ruffy]
- Add some more type information to the strength reduction pass. (3993) [Fabian Ruffy]
- FreeBSD patches (3991) [Jason Bacon]
- Also include the backend IR files in the ir-generated library file. (3985) [Fabian Ruffy]
- Set up P4C for IWYU (3981) [Fabian Ruffy]
- Make StateVariable an IR class that accepts IR::Member. Use ICastable for some nodes. (3741) [Fabian Ruffy]
- Cleanup some P4Testgen code.  (3978) [Fabian Ruffy]
- Bump Bazel dependency versions to enable using latest Bazel (3979) [Bili Dong]
- Add style and formating files for Python. Format Python code. (3870) [Fabian Ruffy]
- Implement support for default initializers (...) (3968) [Mihai Budiu]
- Always insert instantiation statement at the end of the local statement list (3962) [Bili Dong]
- ir generator fixes + cleanup (3975) [Chris Dodd]
- initialize json pointer (coverity fix) (3972) [Glen Gibb]
- ebpf/PSA: Fix weekly PTF tests (3969) [Jan Palimąka]
- Resolve types in the prepend internal extern. (3964) [Fabian Ruffy]
- Change array index[] in table keys in context.json to $ to match with the key name in bfrt.json (3963) [Usha Gupta]
- Clean up the trace event class of P4Tools.  (3950) [Fabian Ruffy]
- Remove gsl-lite module. Introduce std::referencewrapper. (3961) [Fabian Ruffy]
- Remove the inja submodule and replace it with a CMake fetchcontent instrumentation. (3959) [Fabian Ruffy]
- Remove boost variant from Tools. (3960) [Fabian Ruffy]
- Fix the following issues (3958) [Usha Gupta]

[P4Testgen] Implement meter support for the BMv2 V1model PTF test back end (#3974)

* Fun with meters.

* Drop support for direct meters for now.

* Implement direct meters.

* Comments and cleanup.

* Fixes.

* Rebase fixes.

* Rebase fixes.

* Review comments.

* Rebase fixes.

* Fix ternary match handling.

NVFMSA-2399 Fix initialization-order-fiasco of P4CoreLibrary instance (#3994)

Replaced the usage of static variable P4CoreLibrary::instance by
static method P4CoreLibrary::instance(). This static method returns
the static variable of P4CoreLibrary instance.
Now the core library instance is created in one place irrespective of
the order of its usage across several source files. Thus it prevents
the initialization-order-fiasco for P4CoreLibrary instance.

Co-authored-by: Pitchumani Sivanupandi <pitchumani.sivanupandi@intel.com>

misc helper functions (#3995)

- fix JSON string output to escape "/tab/newline properly
Make P4_16 the default parser option. (#4002)

[P4Testgen] More StateVariable refactoring. Allow PathExpression to be state variables.  (#3990)

* Remove unneeded compiler passes.

* StateVariables can also be PathExpressions. Better type checking.

* The actionDataVar was never used in the table steppers.

* The P4 constants file can be more general, move it to common/lib.

* Make some table utilities more general. Move them into common/lib.

[P4Testgen] Fix include paths (#3997)

* Fix include paths.

* Review comments.

* Fix swapped variables.

generic -O option to set optimization level/options (#4206)

- disable inlining in frontend with -O0

pull_request.title: generic -O option to set optimization level/options

commits.message: Do not randomize.
Verbose output.
Fix another segmentation fault when using the coverable nodes scanner. (#4203)

generic -O option to set optimization level/options

- disable inlining in frontend with -O0

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -227,30 +230,37 @@ const IR::P4Program *FrontEnd::run(const CompilerOptions &options, const IR::P4P
         new RemoveAllUnusedDeclarations(&refMap),
         new RemoveRedundantParsers(&refMap, &typeMap),
         new ClearTypeMap(&typeMap),
-        evaluator,
-        new Inline(&refMap, &typeMap, evaluator, options.optimizeParserInlining),
-        new InlineActions(&refMap, &typeMap),
-        new LocalizeAllActions(&refMap),
-        new UniqueNames(&refMap),
-        new UniqueParameters(&refMap, &typeMap),
-        // Must be done before inlining functions, to allow
-        // function calls used as action arguments to be inlined
-        // in the proper place.
-        new RemoveActionParameters(&refMap, &typeMap),
-        new InlineFunctions(&refMap, &typeMap),
-        new SetHeaders(&refMap, &typeMap),
-        // Check for constants only after inlining
-        new CheckConstants(&refMap, &typeMap),
-        new SimplifyControlFlow(&refMap, &typeMap),
-        new RemoveParserControlFlow(&refMap, &typeMap),  // more ifs may have been added to parsers
-        new UniqueNames(&refMap),                        // needed again after inlining
-        new MoveDeclarations(),                          // needed again after inlining
-        new SimplifyDefUse(&refMap, &typeMap),
-        new RemoveAllUnusedDeclarations(&refMap),
-        new SimplifyControlFlow(&refMap, &typeMap),
+        evaluator
+    });
+    if (options.optimizationLevel > 0)
+        passes.addPasses({
+            new Inline(&refMap, &typeMap, evaluator, options.optimizeParserInlining),
+            new InlineActions(&refMap, &typeMap),
+            new LocalizeAllActions(&refMap),
+            new UniqueNames(&refMap),
+            new UniqueParameters(&refMap, &typeMap),
+            // Must be done before inlining functions, to allow
+            // function calls used as action arguments to be inlined
+            // in the proper place.
+            new RemoveActionParameters(&refMap, &typeMap),
+            new InlineFunctions(&refMap, &typeMap),
comment.body: Ideally it should be in the midend, but it does eliminate some constructs that later passes do not expect, so it may not be easy to do that.

commits.message:
generic -O option to set optimization level/options

- disable inlining in frontend with -O0

pull_request.title: generic -O option to set optimization level/options

comment.body: Yes, adding a trailing comma seems to fix the strange clang-format formatting that occurs -- I'll use that instead.

pull_request.title: generic -O option to set optimization level/options

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -227,30 +230,37 @@ const IR::P4Program *FrontEnd::run(const CompilerOptions &options, const IR::P4P
         new RemoveAllUnusedDeclarations(&refMap),
         new RemoveRedundantParsers(&refMap, &typeMap),
         new ClearTypeMap(&typeMap),
-        evaluator,
-        new Inline(&refMap, &typeMap, evaluator, options.optimizeParserInlining),
-        new InlineActions(&refMap, &typeMap),
-        new LocalizeAllActions(&refMap),
-        new UniqueNames(&refMap),
-        new UniqueParameters(&refMap, &typeMap),
-        // Must be done before inlining functions, to allow
-        // function calls used as action arguments to be inlined
-        // in the proper place.
-        new RemoveActionParameters(&refMap, &typeMap),
-        new InlineFunctions(&refMap, &typeMap),
-        new SetHeaders(&refMap, &typeMap),
-        // Check for constants only after inlining
-        new CheckConstants(&refMap, &typeMap),
-        new SimplifyControlFlow(&refMap, &typeMap),
-        new RemoveParserControlFlow(&refMap, &typeMap),  // more ifs may have been added to parsers
-        new UniqueNames(&refMap),                        // needed again after inlining
-        new MoveDeclarations(),                          // needed again after inlining
-        new SimplifyDefUse(&refMap, &typeMap),
-        new RemoveAllUnusedDeclarations(&refMap),
-        new SimplifyControlFlow(&refMap, &typeMap),
+        evaluator
+    });
+    if (options.optimizationLevel > 0)
+        passes.addPasses({
+            new Inline(&refMap, &typeMap, evaluator, options.optimizeParserInlining),
+            new InlineActions(&refMap, &typeMap),
+            new LocalizeAllActions(&refMap),
+            new UniqueNames(&refMap),
+            new UniqueParameters(&refMap, &typeMap),
+            // Must be done before inlining functions, to allow
+            // function calls used as action arguments to be inlined
+            // in the proper place.
+            new RemoveActionParameters(&refMap, &typeMap),
+            new InlineFunctions(&refMap, &typeMap),
comment.body: This defaults to `-O1`, so these backends will only have problems if given an explicit `-O0`.  However, the inlining should probably be moved to the midend as inlining being required (or not) is really target specific.

-        new SimplifyDefUse(&refMap, &typeMap),

comment.body: Some later stages that don't know about functions or action calls may have problems. I guess you will discover quickly.
